intro: Brasilaelia lobata, commonly known as the red-eyed tree frog plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hairy seeds.
